page.title: 07FUND RAISING IN BOLDRE
page.content: Nearly all the Clubs in Boldre/Pilley raise funds, the majority almost exclusively to pay their running costs and to improve their facilities.From Play School to Darby and Joan,Church to Tug-of-War,S.Baddesley School and W.I. to Boldre Hall and Scouts,all run Jumble sales,Coffee Mornings, Bring and Buy sales,Market Stalls,Bazaars and "100 Club"Lotteries.Some recieve covenants,all accept donations!While raising funds in the same way,the Brownies and Boldre W.I.donatemost of the money they raise to local charities.Local support for these functions fluctuates with the interest of the occasion and the enthusiasm of the organisers but 60% is the average. Each year the Church,Hall and T.o.W. between them raise Â£36000,while the rest share Â£4000,totalling Â£40000-over Â£24 per name on the electoral roll.
